name: 莎士比亞的故事
description: This course provides an introduction to the tales of the major plays of William Shakespeare (1564-1616). With this course, students will encounter and enjoy at least four major plays of the author.
goals: Students who select this course are expected to team up to do a few oral presentations in the semester and hand in their individual assignments on time.
syllabus:
Tales from Shakespeare

This course provides an introduction to the tales of the major plays of William Shakespeare (1564-1616). With this course, students will encounter and enjoy at least four major plays of the author.  
  
1\. The text to be used is _Tales from Shakespeare_ by Charles and Mary Lamb (NEWLY REVISED EDITION).  
  
2\. Students who select this course are expected to write two coherent and well-organized essays (3000 words in Chinese, or 1500 words in English), and submit their individual assignments on time.   
  
3\. Regular and prompt attendance at classes is demanded. Being late for over 15 minutes will be counted as an absence. Every absence will result in three points being deducted from the final grade average. Three absences might result in a total failure of the course.   
  
  
Some relevant reading materials:  
1\. Bentley, Gerald Eades, ed. _The Seventeenth-Century Stage_. Chicago and London: U of Chicago P, 1968.  
2\. Biggs, Murray, et al., eds. _The Arts of Performance in Elizabethan and Early Stuart Drama_. Edinburgh: Edinburgh UP, 1991.  
3\. Greenblatt, Stephen, ed. _The Norton Shakespeare, Based on the Oxford Edition_. NY and London: Norton, 2008.  
4\. Gurr, Andrew. _The Shakespearean Stage_, 1574-1642. 3rd ed. Cambridge: Cambridge UP, 1992.  
5\. Hinman, Charlton, ed. _The First Folio of Shakespeare_. New York: Norton, 1968.

6\. ---, ed. _The First Folio of Shakespeare, Based on the Folger Shakespeare Library Collection_. 2nd ed. New York: Norton, 1996.  
7\. Norman, Marc, and Tom Stoppard. _Shakespeare in Love: A Screenplay_. NY: Hyperion, 1998.  
8\. Taylor, Gary, John Jowett, Terri Bourus, and Gabriel Egan, eds. _The New Oxford Shakespeare: The Complete Works_. Edited by Gary Taylor, John Jowett, Terri Bourus, and Gabriel Egan. Oxford: Oxford UP, 2016.

methodologies.note: 本課程將結合影像及講義作必要之解說與闡述。
老師會藉由討論或問問題與同學在課堂上交換意見，也歡迎同學於課堂上或下課後提問，教學相長。
藉由欣賞莎劇之劇場與電影之精彩演出認識莎士比亞劇作。
